I haven't even fallen in love to begin with...
My advice here is to try not to cram a bunch of studying into one session. Breaking it up into smaller sessions makes it easier and more manageable for you.

The one thing I love about my body is my big twintails! They've been a defining feature of me since day one!

♫Happy birthday to me, happy birthday to me! Happy birthday to Miku, happy birthday to me!♪
Maki-san, I remember when μ's began to get popular all over Japan. My friend Rin was a huge fan of your music!
Maki-san, what made you want to leave the idol life behind? I get that you can't be an idol forever, unless you're me, but it would've been nice to see μ's keep going for a little bit longer.
Hey, Aoba-chan, you're a game developer, correct? It's really cool to see people turn simple 1's and 0's into things that bring people a lot of joy, and I speak from experience on that! Hehehe!

Aoba-chan, you're a video game developer, right? That's really cool! Games bring a lot of joy to a lot of people, and knowing you help make that joy for others is awesome! That's something I truly appreciate.
Reimu-san, sorry for asking, but you seem to be a little disconnected from the modern world. What kind of technology are you familiar with?
Reimu-san, I heard you talking about youkai earlier. I've heard about them, since I'm from Japan, but I don't know much about them. Could you explain what they are?
Moon-chan, if you're okay with me asking this question, is Moon really your name, or is it just a nickname? The reason I'm asking is because I've heard some people call by the name "Selene."

Dawn-chan, you seem to be somewhat infatuated with ~player~-san. I'm sorry if I'm asking a sensitive question, but do you have feelings for them? It's okay if you do. (I think the feeling might be mutual too.)
Dawn-chan, I absolutely love your hat! Do you know where I could possibly get one? It would great with one of my winter outfits!
Stocking-san, you're also an idol, right? Your performances must attract a different type of crowd than mine.
Fate-san, you seem like a man of culture. You must have a pretty good taste of music in that case! So, what's your favorite genre of music?

Meia-san, being the captain of a spacecraft, you must have a lot of experience working together with others. I collaborate on songs with my fellow Vocaloids almost all the time. Granted, our expertise is different, but it's still the same idea.

Sucrose-chan, I can't help but notice how curious you are about everything going on. I greatly admire curiosity in a person, as it helps them to learn more about the world around them, and themselves! Are you trying to learn more about your sexuality and feelings by being here?

Senko-chan, I've got a question that I think you could help me out on. You see, as an idol, I find myself under stress from time to time, with all the concerts and moving about. I was wondering if you had some self-help tips that could help alleviate some of that stress?
So, Do you all have any favorite love songs?
So, I'm curious, do any of you have a favorite love song?
Hey, question: What's your favorite love song?

♫Yai! Yai! Let's go play! Yai! Yai! Laugh, now laugh! Rai! Rai! Close hands, open hands! Rai! Rai! Demons and the Dead! One, two, three, open your hands! Five, six, seven, put them in the air! Dangling by the collar from a pine tree! All together, all together, close them again!♪
♫I don't want to harbor a love that will never end. Come on, fill me more with anxiety. I'd like you to act your part at peek a boo. Come on, answer to what I ask more properly!♪

♫Tonight, for you, I offer up this body. With you it's special. This isn't flattery or lip service. Aah! I'm in love! Everything reflected in your eyes. Stirs hatred in me. Don't look at anything else but me!♪

My hands always freeze in the cold, but when I put on my scarf and my gloves I got from Santa, It's so warm, it's so warm. It feels like I'm being held by mama. It makes me so happy.♪

Okay, so, for some reason, people keep saying that I wrote the Harry Potter book series, but I can't understand why. Would someone be willing to explain that to me?

When one performs, they must put on a show! They can't let anything stop them!
A show is only as good as the one who's performing! The better the performer, the better the show!
A performer must always be ready for a show! The more you're prepared, the better you'll be!
KAITO's always been like a big brother to me. When I first joined the Vocaloid family, he made me feel welcome and showed me the ropes. That's something I'll always be thankful for!

One thing Rin and Len love to do is play pranks. I remember one day that Len thought it would be funny to throw a pie in my face. Not only was I unamused, it also made quite the mess! MEIKO gave him quite the lecture afterwards!

I've always been really close to Luka. She's my best friend, and I love to hang out with her! Whenever we're not on stage, we're hanging out and having fun! Sometimes, I wonder if she ever wants to be "more than friends" though.

MEIKO's always been like a mother figure to me. She's always looking out for me. I remember one day, I had botched up a performance so badly, and I had gone to my dressing room to cry, and MEIKO was there to comfort me and make sure I was alright.

MEIKO loves to drink wine. She drinks a lot of it, to the point she can get a bit tipsy. She's never been completely drunk though! Sometimes, I feel as if wine's like an energy drink for her, as she tends to get a boost of confidence after a long drinking session!
You know, Gumi actually got a game of her own at one point! I can't remember what it was called, but that doesn't really matter. It was a terrible game anyway. Hehehe!

You know, I just remembered is that Teto isn't technically a Vocaloid, but is rather a "Utauloid." That's because she comes from Utau, another digital singing program. Utau is free to download, and she loves to emphasize that point when we get together!
So, I should mention that Haku isn't a Vocaloid, but rather a Fanloid. Her voice is just a deeper version of mine, so no wonder her voice sounds so good! Hehehe!

So, Neru's not really a Vocaloid. She was made by the fans. As such, she doesn't have an official voice bank. She tends to prefer communicating via text anyhow. She thinks it makes her sounds grumpier than she already is!
Now, when I was talking about lewd photographs of me earlier, I wasn't referring to lewd artwork of me. There's already so much of that, I've accepted their existence and I'm just letting it slide.

So, I know I referred to myself as a Vocaloid earlier, but technically, I'm not anymore. My creators had a contractual dispute with the people who made the Vocaloid program, and they took me with them. That's what I can remember a least. I'm not really versed in legal disputes.

So, are any of you familiar with some of my Vocaloid Friends? Yowane Haku is a "distant relative" of sorts. She's rather shy, and prefers to stay out of the limelight, but she's got a beautiful voice.
So, are any of you familiar with some of my Vocaloid Friends? Akita Neru is probably the biggest grump I've ever met. She means well, but she's as stubborn as a bull.
So, now that I'm naked, I've got a confession to make: I'm a virgin. I've never had sex with anyone before, and personally, that was because I had no need to, since I'm digital.
Okay, I know this is coming out of nowhere, but I've never had sex before. Since I'm digital, I've never had a need to do so.
So, I don't think I've mentioned this, but I'm a digital singer known as a Vocaloid. My voice actually comes from a digital sound bank. Pretty cool, huh?
I haven't mentioned this until now, but I'm what's called a Vocaloid. Essentially, I'm a digital singer whose voice is provided by a sound bank of sorts.
Okay, so I've neglected to mention this until now, but I'm a digital singer called a Vocaloid. My voice is provided by a digital sound bank. It's really fancy!
If any of you are going to try to make a wager with me, please don't. Last I time I did that was with Luka, who made me bet on a game of Blackjack. Needless to say, I did not end up winning.
If any of you are planning to make a bet with me, please don't. I made a wager with Luka sometime back over a game of Blackjack, which didn't end up going my way.

Has anybody heard of Miku Expo? That's what my concerts are called, and I'll be headed to my next one after we're done with this game. Would anybody be interested in attending? I'm sure I could hook you all up with a few backstage passes!

Have any of you been to one of my concerts before? They're called Miku Expo, and if you haven't, you should come and see one! They're a lot of fun! In fact, I'll be going to my next performance right after this game! If any of you want to attend, I'd be more than happy to offer you a backstage pass!

Do you mind if I share a secret? I really had a blast playing with you all. As much as I love my fans, I rarely ever get a chance to let loose and hang out with other people, so this game was quite a treat.

Can I be honest with you all? I really enjoyed getting a chance to just have some fun and let loose. As great as it is to perform for hundreds of people, getting to chill with others in a social environment really felt great!

state.text: I'm sure if y'all were aware, but today is "Miku Day!" No, it's not my birthday, but I'm very closely tied to the number 39. In Japanese, the number is sometimes called "Miku", hence my connection with the number, and the date!
So, today is "Miku Day." It's a day created by my fans to celebrate me, because in Japanese, the number 39 can be interpreted as "Miku", and that's why March 9th is celebrated by my fans!
